trans-unit.source: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore is the core disaster recovery protection included for all Basic, Standard, and Premium Azure SQL Databases service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore is the core disaster recovery protection included for all Basic, Standard, and Premium Azure SQL Databases service tiers.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You must use certificate based authentication to run the following cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: You must use certificate based authentication to run the following cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the Use the certificate method section in How to install and configure Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the Use the certificate method section in How to install and configure Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Get the list of recoverable databases by using the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Get the list of recoverable databases by using the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following parameter:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following parameter:

trans-unit.source: ServerName where the database is located.
trans-unit.target: ServerName where the database is located.

trans-unit.source: PS C:\>Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase -ServerName "myserver"
trans-unit.target: PS C:\>Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase -ServerName "myserver"

trans-unit.source: Choose the database you want to recover from by using the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Choose the database you want to recover from by using the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: ServerName where the database is located.
trans-unit.target: ServerName where the database is located.

trans-unit.source: DatabaseName of the database you are recovering from.
trans-unit.target: DatabaseName of the database you are recovering from.

trans-unit.source: PS C:\>$Database = Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase -ServerName "myserver" –DatabaseName “mydb”
trans-unit.target: PS C:\>$Database = Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase -ServerName "myserver" –DatabaseName “mydb”

trans-unit.source: Begin the recover by using the <linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRecovery</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Begin the recover by using the <linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRecovery</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: SourceDatabase you want to recover.
trans-unit.target: SourceDatabase you want to recover.

trans-unit.source: TargetDatabaseName of the database you are recovering to.
trans-unit.target: TargetDatabaseName of the database you are recovering to.

trans-unit.source: TargetServerName you want to recover the database to.
trans-unit.target: TargetServerName you want to recover the database to.

trans-unit.source: Store what is returned to a variable called $RestoreRequest.
trans-unit.target: Store what is returned to a variable called $RestoreRequest.

trans-unit.source: This variable contains the restore request ID which is used for monitoring the status of a restore.
trans-unit.target: This variable contains the restore request ID which is used for monitoring the status of a restore.

trans-unit.source: PS C:\>$RecoveryRequest = Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRecovery -SourceDatabase $Database –TargetDatabaseName “myrecoveredDB” –TargetServerName “mytargetserver”
trans-unit.target: PS C:\>$RecoveryRequest = Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRecovery -SourceDatabase $Database –TargetDatabaseName “myrecoveredDB” –TargetServerName “mytargetserver”

trans-unit.source: A database recovery may take some time to complete.
trans-unit.target: A database recovery may take some time to complete.

trans-unit.source: To monitor the status of the recovery, use the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation</linkText><title></title> cmdlet and specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: To monitor the status of the recovery, use the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation</linkText><title></title> cmdlet and specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: ServerName of the database you are restoring to.
trans-unit.target: ServerName of the database you are restoring to.

trans-unit.source: OperationGuid which is the Restore Request ID that was stored in the $RecoveryRequest variable in Step 3.
trans-unit.target: OperationGuid which is the Restore Request ID that was stored in the $RecoveryRequest variable in Step 3.

trans-unit.source: PS C:\>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation –ServerName “mytargetserver” –OperationGuid $RecoveryRequest.ID
trans-unit.target: PS C:\>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation –ServerName “mytargetserver” –OperationGuid $RecoveryRequest.ID

trans-unit.source: The State and PercentComplete fields show the status of the restore.
trans-unit.target: The State and PercentComplete fields show the status of the restore.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restore a deleted Azure SQL database in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restore a deleted Azure SQL database in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Business Continuity</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Geo-Restore (blog)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Geo-Restore (blog)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
